[ Package Index | Mudlib Index | Effect Index ]

File /std/dom/interview_inherit.c

Domain Interview Room @author Drakkos @started on 02/12/2000

Inherits

This class inherits the following classes /std/room.c

Includes

This class includes the following files /include/player_handler.h and /include/mail.h

Public Functions

These are functions that everyone can access.

.
add_candidate
int add_candidate(string name)
Add a candidate to the list. Will not send part two of the application to them.

Parameters:
name - name of the player to add.
Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success
add_confirmed
int add_confirmed(string name)
add_creator
int add_creator(string name)
Entry point to the add creator command.

Parameters:
name - name of the creator to allow
Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success.
add_interviewed
int add_interviewed(string name)
clear_candidates
int clear_candidates()
Clear the list of player candidates.

Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success
clear_interviewed
int clear_interviewed()
Clear the list of interviewed players.

Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success
do_add
int do_add(string candidate)
Start off a creator application by sending them out the second part of the application procedure.

Parameters:
candidate - the name to send the second part of the application to.
Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success
do_confirm
int do_confirm(string candidate)
Confirm receipt of a candidate's submission.

Parameters:
candidate - name of the player to add.
Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success
do_end
int do_end()
The function to end the interview. Will write an entry in the interview text containing who the interview was with and when the interview was ended. It will then add the subject to the list of interviewed names and save the object. Finally, it will reset the subject of the room.

Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success.
do_flag
int do_flag(string name,
string flag)
Entry point for the flag command. Sets an application as accepted or rejected, and sends out the appropriate form mail.

Parameters:
name - name of candidate.
flag - "accepted" or "rejected"
Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success.
do_interview
varargs int do_interview(object ob,
string names)
This function is the main entry point for the interview code. It will set the subject of the room, and write an entry in the interview text containing who the interview is with, when it was started, and who conducted the interview.

Parameters:
ob - the object to interview
Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success
do_list
int do_list()
do_query
int do_query()
Query the current state of applications.

Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success
do_query_text
int do_query_text(string flag)
Entry point for the query command.

Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success.
do_read
int do_read(string name)
This function will take the name of a player and if the interview document for that player exists, print it to the screen of this_player().

Parameters:
name - the name of the player.
Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success.
do_show
int do_show()
This function will show the embedded 'movie' text at regular intervals.

Returns:
returns 0 on failure, 1 on success.
do_stop
int do_stop()

void event_emote(object ob,
string mess)
flush
int flush()
Flush the candidate, interviewed and submitted lists.

Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success
load
void load()
play_movie
void play_movie(int i)
This function does a person_say event on the environmen. The content of the event is the relevant movie text to be said.

Parameters:
i - the index of the movie to be be played.
query_acceptance
string query_acceptance()
Query the acceptance mail text.

Returns:
the rejection text

Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success.

string query_applicants_text()
Return which candidates have been mailed, which have sent in their submission, and which are left to be interviewed or replied to.

Returns:
the text to be displayed

string query_cc()
Query the names cc'd by default.

Returns:
an imploded string of cc'd names

string query_confirmation()
Returns the confirmation mail text.

Returns:
The confirmation text
query_domain
string query_domain()
Return the domain the room exists in.

Returns:
The name of the domain, or 'unset' if none is set.
query_interview
int query_interview()
Return whether creator candidates require an interview for this domain.

Returns:
0 if an interview is not required. Anything else if it is.
query_interview_dir
string query_interview_dir()
Return the directory where interviews are to be stored.

Returns:
interview directory.

string query_lord()
Return the domain's lord.

Returns:
the capitalised name of the lord.

Returns:
application text.

int query_part_two_required()

int query_permitted(string name)
query_permitted_creators
string * query_permitted_creators()
Query the creators permitted to use this room.

Returns:
an empty array if no creators are permitted. The array of creators otherwise.
query_rejection
string query_rejection()
Query the rejection mail text.

Returns:
the rejection text
query_subject
string query_subject()
Query the subject of an interview if one is ongoing.

Returns:
0 if there is no subject. The name of the subject if there is.

string * query_submitted()
remove_candidate
int remove_candidate(string candidate)
Delete a player from the list. Will search through all three lists for an occurance of the name before deleting it where found.

Parameters:
candidate - the name of the player to remove.
Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success
remove_creator
int remove_creator(string name)
The entry point to the remove creator command.

Parameters:
name - name of the creator to remove
Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success.

Parameters:
candidate - name of the player to add.
Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success

Parameters:
i - the interview state.

Set the directory where interviews are to be stored.

Parameters:
dir - interview directory.
Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success.
set_movie
void set_movie(string * m)
Tests to see if a particular creator is permitted to make use of the interview room. Domain lords and deputies are always permitted.

Parameters:
name - the name of the object attempting to use the room.
Returns:
1 if the creator is allowed, 0 if they are not.
set_part_two
int set_part_two(string file)
Set the filename for the second part of the application.

Parameters:
file - filename of the second part.
Returns:
0 on failure, 1 on success.

void set_part_two_required(int i)

Set the rejection mail text.

Parameters:
text - the rejection mail text
